titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Division of Industrial and Engineering Chemistry records 1947-1991
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Division of Industrial and Engineering Chemistry records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Division of Industrial & Engineering Chemistry (I&EC) is one of the 33 technical divisions within the ACS. Founded in 1908, it was the first division organized in the ACS. Its main focus is "helping individuals convert science into commercially relevant products and processes."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from the ACS Division of Industrial & Engineering Chemistry. Materials include: minutes and correspondence from the Executive Committee; membership directories; records relating to the Summer Symposia and Chemical Engineering Symposia; annual division reports; awards documentation; by-laws and division handbooks for officers and committee members; and records from subdivisions, such as those for Chemical Processes and Nuclear Technology.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Accession number: Casper box (92:10); other boxes apparently have no accession number
